ref: 10807 *rūṣṭa ʻ rough, harsh ʼ. [Scarcely < *rūkṣṭa -- , but rather result of ruṣṭa -- 1 ʻ angry ʼ X rūkṣá -- ʻ harsh ʼ (similar contaminations in rūṣita -- ʻ angry ʼ ~ rūkṣayati ʻ offends ʼ, rūṣita -- ʻ roughened ʼ ~ rūkṣá -- , rūṣita-<-> ʻ soiled ʼ ~ rūkṣayati ʻ soils ʼ) which produced *rūṣṭa -- on the one hand and on the other rukṣa -- ʻ dry ʼ Uṇ.com., (for rukṣá -- ʻ shining, burning ʼ RV.) J. C. W.]
Or. ruṭhā ʻ dry, sapless, barren ʼ;
H. rūṛh, rūṛhā ʻ rough, stiff, raw, angry ʼ (<
MIA. *rūṭha -- < *rūṭṭha -- ), rūḍhnā ʻ to be offended ʼ.
